title: So Malzahar is still being played in Proplay Riot!
body:
Patch 7.11
W (Voice Swarm) : **Passive**: On every fourth ability use, Malzahar summons a Voidling that that lasts for 21 seconds or until killed. If Malzahar dies, the Voidling stays behind but stops attacking.

You can clearly see Malza is still a high ban/pick as a support and doens't matter how much you nerf his W and overall damage because he'll always be viable because of his point click  R mostly.

His voidlings are annoying, but they're not the issue that allows malza to support even with his low base damage on ALL of his spells.
You gave him a passive which you've already nerfed to fourth of it's old duration.
Q? damage nerfed.
W? Nerf
E? nerf
R? what is damage?

The whole rework turned malza from a perfectly Assassin counter with lots of counterplay to a pain in the ass damageless lock mage.

replies.body:
I love how people say malzahar lacks counterplay when {{item:3140}} exists, an item that made old malz's combo utterly useless. Not to mention how his effectiveness falls off like a brick past laning phase.

Do people not realize how easy it was to interrupt his ultimate even without qss? He literally stuns himself in place unable to move giving the enemy enough time to react since he can't reposition himself.

People seem to be misinformed as to why he is being picked in the lcs. It isn't just because of his ultimate. It isn't just because of his passive change.

Nor is it just because of those damn voidlings. The entire rework made it so he just functions better as a support. You are literally wasting his potential now by going malzahar mid. 

His damage was severely nerfed across the board, voidlings are easy to kill now with just 2 autos, and they even instadie from aoe. He doesn't lose effectiveness because he doesn't have to commit or put himself in as much danger anymore thanks to voidlings for the low cost of 40 mana lol.

While also being safer doing it to thanks to void shift. Oh and he has an adc to help him kill said person since his solo kill potential is laughable. 

Not to mention his ultimate is still as reliable as ever, a boon in high elo.

A boon that is sitting at a 47% winrate.

Oh, but why can't malza go mid now? Well his hardpushing waveclear was taken out because **its binary** meanwhile viktor e exists. Even fucking leblanc has better waveclear than malz now lol.  Did I mention his solo kill potential? Yea maybe mid-late it'll start kicking in.

To those of you who think old malz will still be played as a support I invite you to google old malzahar's mana costs. He still had a shitty starting mana pool back then as well. But mana return on his e allowed him to lane, if he used his spells just to harass he would be out of mana real fast.

I never suggested a fix for the problem. My point is that unless they actually do something to fix him, he's going to eventually cease to exist as a champion, and risk potentially being tossed.

The whole point of QSS was that it was supposed to be a way to escape QWE CC.

Enemy champs easily recycle QWE CC and could try again quickly... QSS was supposed to be that 1 time in an emergency escape.

QSS on Malzahar is game breaking. It totally ruins his ult.  And destroys his ability to play in Pro-Play.


Additionally, there is no real downside to QSS since it builds in Mercurial Scimitar which has massive AD just like ALL THE OTHER AD ITEMS.
It has NO downside. 

And now with things Like AP Banshee Veil and AD Guardian Angel, there's no downside for everyone to have these items.

The stupid part is that Riot does not seem to understand that resurrection on an AD champ is much better than blocking 1 spell on an AP champ.
AD champs dish out HUGE DAMAGE per AUTO...
AP champs dish out HUGE DAMAGE per Ultimate.

O. wait.  Thats like NNN times more damage per second for AD over AP in the late game.
So, yea, Malzahar ults down the AD champ, and the AD champ hits QSS.  Nevertheless somehow manages to "Kill" the champ just before dying and oops NM... GA clicks in... 

So it does not matter how Malzahar's ult works... it is easily negated.  And since he has no other form of CC, when the GA kicks in... worth 50% HP, Malz is dead.


QSS ruins it for Malzahar. 

What they need to do to fix this, is change Nether Grasp so that if it is interrupted by CC or QSS etc... it converts to a slow for the remainder of the ult. Thus damage is maintained. RIght now, Malzahar's ult is useless with all the CC/QSS he has to contend with.

His shield was supposed to help with that but they reduced the CC protection to .25 secs which is useless for the ultimate.

>Additionally, there is no real downside to QSS since it builds in Mercurial Scimitar which has massive AD just like ALL THE OTHER AD ITEMS.
It has NO downside.

When he forces APs to build it.

>What they need to do to fix this, is change Nether Grasp so that if it is interrupted by CC or QSS etc... it converts to a slow for the remainder of the ult. Thus damage is maintained. 

His R currently does 0 damage by itself. He makes his old W when he uses his R which is where the damage comes from.

>RIght now, Malzahar's ult is useless with all the CC/QSS he has to contend with.

Isn't he played competitively because he forces QSS buys on every carry the enemy team has?

>The whole rework turned malza from a perfectly Assassin counter _with lots of counterplay_to a pain in the ass damageless lock mage.

Lol? I don't think a combo that's almost entirely point/click that forced a QSS buy on every carry was "lots of counterplay".

Zero mobility no sustain champion that needs to set up a very interruptable combo low range whose only strength was to punish melee assassins since everyone else outranges him or tanks his combo. Oh, and said combo is completly useless against more that one person.

Point and click is only one of the few upsides to a very conditional combo that falls off like bricks outside of lane.

I think you're underselling it a little, considering said point and click combo was the main reason he was played and played frequently in solo Q and sometimes in pro play. And was also the reason why he got reworked considering he'd just dump his combo on you with nothing you could do about it. If you could perfectly predict when he'd use R you could throw a CC with travel time to interrupt it yourself but that's really it outside of a QSS purchase.

I'm not saying he was OP or anything, but to say tons of counterplay isn't right.

I don't know about frequently.. as I recall, his pickrate wasn't stellar in solo queue. He was a pubstomper, but he wasn't a common one. He wasn't particularly rare, but not frequent either. 

As someone who likes pre-rework Malzahar, I absolutely agree that he didn't have tons of counterplay. There's a reason I picked him and it wasn't because of the freedom he gave the enemies to stop him. There were ways to beat him, certainly, but unless BKB had been brought to League then by no means was his counterplay abundant.
{{item:3140}} is your BKB. With actual stats.

That... that is not even close to comparable to BKB. That's a single strong dispel effect on demand, in DotA terms. I can get what that item does by an Abaddon using his Aphotic Shield on me, or a Legion Commander using her Attack Speed steroid on me, but those aren't BKB, either. 

BKB does more than just make you immune to CC over its duration, it also makes you immune to most spell effects. QSS just has some resistance, not immunity.
Which is all you need against Malz because he has 1 CC.

QSS didn't stop the 550 + 130% ap flat damage though

Only the suppress... Which is why it always gave me a chuckle when I see people buy it pre-rework.

He wasnt used in proplay AT ALL because his weaknesses ourweighted his advantages (and that was FINE, because not every hero should be LCS material and then be nerfed just for a short time of glory), and his soloqueue pickrate was on the 2-3%.

And his combo, the thing that many fear, had minimal range for midlane, and the nature of his silence didnt allow flash-combo initiations. Not to mention it was exclusively a 1v1 thing because the smallest of CCs could cancel it, or even easier, QSS. His combo wasnt ''the reason'' why he was played, he was played by his mains and basically no one else. His conditional, anti assassin combo was what gave him a niche and at the same time allowed him to be strong, because of its conditionals and being basically counterpick specific.

And tbh? Riot reworked him in complete ignorance of his playstyle (lmao @ ''he is a flash assassin'' I have never heard anything more ignorant of Malz in my life) with no intent other that change for the sake of fucking change, and now Malz is one of the most nerfed champions EVER because his reworked kit actually managed to increase everything that it was supposed to diminish, and increased his weakness to QSS, while making him be what Riot pretended he actually was.

The rework:

- Lowered his skillfloor massively. Faster Q, lower mana costs, actually non-interactive, izi farm lane (which pre-rework wasnt posible without early AP rush and/or at rank 4 E), decreased his need for positionement exponentially and his sustain weakness with the same change, the shield.

- Took away damage, and what was left, was put in a completly non-interactive spell, that also had way more effective range that . Q was an skillshot, E was balanced around its lack of range, and his R was balanced around being a channel, rooting Malz, and its shitty range.

- Gutted his anti assassin niche, which no, is NOT ''survives assassins'', it was ''try to dive me you zed bitch and you die''.

- Made his minions on-demand, where before he needed to dump several spells to get one.

- Took away the capacity of using his anti-tank W damage, which with LiandRylai was actually extremely strong midgame onwards.

The rework is easily on par with Karma's on the level of how idiotical, ignorant and blabantly misinformed it was. Or intentionally wanted to break/deletework a champion some rioter didnt like. Whatever the case is, the meme that is '' uwu old malz was just as bad uwu'' is just that, a meme born from riot bandwagoning and assassin tears.

"You can clearly see Malza is still a high ban/pick as a support and doens't matter how much you nerf his W and overall damage because he'll always be viable because of his point click R mostly."

So basically a more useless Naut support?

not necessarily more useless because the suppression of Malz's R is instant, as opposed to Nautilus's having to travel. This can actually make a very big difference in pro play because any sort of travel time means the targeted victim has time to reposition themselves. They don't get that mercy with Malzahar.

Tell you what, disable everyone's AA and spell casting for 1 second after a flash, and I am ok with it. Otherwise, the idea is very one sided and picks only on Malzahar. 
My recommendation is to leave the flash mechanic alone._


**The real fix for Malzahar is a 3 step approach:**

Change his W so that it casts a Pre-Rework Null Zone. From the Center of the Null Zone, ONE voidling spawns with frenzy potential and HP.  This voidling ONLY multiplies for Jg Camps and Monsters (NOT Champions).   THIS change addressed the concerns that the support lanes have with too many voidlings. And it allows Malzahar to Jg again.  It brings back the damage that was taken away by bringing back the null zone.

Change E:   to add "True Vision" to anything affected by Malefic Visions.  (Which makes sense, and addresses the problem where an enemy champ afflicted with visions can run into a bush and the voidlings become suddenly stupid).

R: Nether Grasp, IF it is interrupted by anything (CC, QSS etc), the suppress converts to a slow for the duration of the ult.  This allows Malzahar to at least have SOME CC on his ult target, and not lose all the damage when he gets interrupted. (Which is the single most important reason why he does not see Pro-play).

Lastly, Change his passive so that the cc block is back to 0.5sec.
